data.name: XDocumentDigitalSignatures
desc: Interface for signing and verifying digital signatures in office documents.
This interface can be used to digitally sign different content in an office document. It can also be used to verify digital signatures.
**since**
LibreOffice 5.3

methods.name: chooseCertificate
desc: This method shows the CertificateChooser dialog, used by document and PDF signing Shows only private certificates.
**since**
LibreOffice 5.3

methods.name: chooseCertificateWithProps
desc: This method shows the CertificateChooser dialog, used by document and PDF signing Shows only private certificates and returns usage string in addition to description.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.0

methods.name: chooseEncryptionCertificate
desc: This method shows the CertificateChooser dialog with all certificates, private and other people's.
Useful when choosing certificate/key for encryption
**since**
LibreOffice 6.0

methods.name: chooseSigningCertificate
desc: This is an alias for 'chooseCertificate', shows the CertificateChooser dialog with private certificates.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.0

methods.name: getDocumentContentSignatureDefaultStreamName
desc: allows to get the default stream name for storing of the signature of the document content.

methods.name: getPackageSignatureDefaultStreamName
desc: allows to get the default stream name for storing of the signature of the package.

methods.name: getScriptingContentSignatureDefaultStreamName
desc: allows to get the default stream name for storing of the signature of the scripting content.

methods.name: manageTrustedSources
desc: manages trusted sources (Authors and paths )

methods.name: selectSigningCertificate
desc: This shows the certificate selection dialog and allows to only select the certificate without actually signing the document.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.1

methods.name: selectSigningCertificateWithType
desc: This shows the certificate selection dialog and allows to only select the certificate without actually signing the document.
Only certificates of the given type will be shown.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.2

methods.name: setParentWindow
desc: Set parent window to use when showing dialogs.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.3

methods.name: showDocumentContentSignatures
desc: shows the digital signatures of the document content

methods.name: showPackageSignatures
desc: shows the digital signatures of the package

methods.name: showScriptingContentSignatures
desc: shows the digital signatures of the scripting content

methods.name: signDocumentContent
desc: signs the content of the document including text and pictures.
Macros will not be signed.

methods.name: signDocumentWithCertificate
desc: Signs the content of the document with the provided certificate.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.2

methods.name: signPackage
desc: signs the full Package, which means everything in the storage except the content of META-INF

methods.name: signPackageWithCertificate
desc: signs the full Package, which means everything in the storage except the content of META-INF with the provided certificate.
**since**
LibreOffice 7.0

methods.name: signScriptingContent
desc: signs the content of the Scripting including macros and basic dialogs
The rest of document content will not be signed.

methods.name: signScriptingContentWithCertificate
desc: signs the content of the Scripting including macros and basic dialogs with the provided certificate.
The rest of document content will not be signed.
**since**
LibreOffice 7.0

methods.name: signSignatureLine
desc: Signs the content of the document including text and pictures using the given XCertificate.
Also adds the given Signature Line Id and the signed and unsigned graphics to the signature.
Macros will not be signed.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.1

methods.name: verifyDocumentContentSignatures
desc: checks for digital signatures and their status.
Only document content will be checked.

methods.name: verifyPackageSignatures
desc: checks for digital signatures and their status.
Only Package content will be checked.

methods.name: verifyScriptingContentSignatures
desc: checks for digital signatures and their status.
Only Scripting content will be checked.
